wikipedia_page.main: Melville Portal JP, DL (31 July 1819 – 24 January 1904) was a British Conservative Party politician from Hampshire.

response: *Lady Charlotte (died 1899), married the Conservative MP Melville Portal.
*Sir Wyndham Spencer Portal, 1st Bt., (1822–1905), of Laverstoke, local philanthropist who paid for some of church's 1848 re-fit. A younger brother of Melville Portal.common knowledge
*Melville Portal (1819–1904), MP for North Hampshire (1849–1857)Harrow, 1800–1911, p. 144

List of presidents of the Oxford Union

response: Gerald Portal was the second son of the politician Melville Portal. He was educated at Eton College, joined the diplomatic service as an attaché in 1879, and was posted to Rome where he was promoted to third secretary of legation in 1881.
